Submodules

neo.cli module

This file contains the command line interface

Author: R. Thomas Place: U. of Sheffield Year: 2023-24 Licence: GPLv3 Pylint v3.0.3 score: 10

This function set up the command line interface

of argument given in the command line

Return

with argument analysed

neo.hardcoded module

This file is part of the neo module It lists all the hardcoded elements

Author: R. Thomas Place: U. of Sheffield Year: 2023 Licence: GPLv3 Pylint v3.0.3 score: 10

neo.meta_func module

This is the file with all the meta functions used directly from command line argument

Author: R. Thomas Year: 2023-24 Place: U. of Sheffield Licence: GPLv3 Pylint: 8.76

neo.meta_func.single_matrix(matrixfile, name, first_row, skill_column, plot=True)[source]

This meta function extracts the matrix of a single topic. If the plot function is used, the two plots are given:

  • N people vs skills

  • Total proficiency vs skills

Parameters

matrixfilestr

file name

namestr

name of a matrix in the file

first_rowint

first spreadsheet row where the table starts (header line)

skill_column: str

letter of the column where skills are

Return

matrixdict

with matrix data

neo.meta_func.single_rse(matrixfile, name, first_row, skill_column, rse, plot=True)[source]

This meta function extracts the matrix of a single topic and the data of a single RSE. If the plot function is used a proficiency spider plot is displayed

Parameters

matrixfilestr

file name

namestr

name of a matrix in the file

first_rowint

first spreadsheet row where the table starts (header line)

skill_column: str

letter of the column where skills are

rsestr

name of the rse

Return

matrixdict

with matrix data

neo.meta_func.training_matrix(matrixfile, plot=True)[source]

This function is called when training is given as argument it plots the training need program.

Parameters

matrixfilestr

file with skills matrix

plotbool

If you want to display the plot

Return

needsdict

skills : Training needs (number)

neo.plot_matrix module

This file gathers the source code that plots skills matrices.

Author: R. Thomas Year: 2023-24 Place: U. of Sheffield Licence: GPLv3 Pylint: 10

neo.plot_matrix.make_matrix_barplot(name, matrix, fig=None, ax=None, title='RSE matrix')[source]

This function makes a polar barplot to represent the matrix

Parameter

namestr

Name of the matrix

matrixdict

skill vs number

Return

None

neo.plot_matrix.make_rse_indiv(rse_skills, rse_name, fig=None, ax=None, title='RSE matrix')[source]

This is the method that creates the plot for an individual rse

neo.plot_matrix.make_training(needs, fig=None, ax=None)[source]

This function prepares data to that will then be plotted in the skills matrix template

neo.plot_matrix.plot_aestethics(ax, title, axis='off', ticks_on=True, nticks=10, circles_on=True, circles_rad=[5, 10, 15, 20])[source]

This is a generic function to make the aesthetics of the plots

neo.read_skills_matrix module

This files is the source code containing classes to read matrices from spreadsheet

Author : R. Thomas Place : U. of Sheffield Year: 2023-24 Licence: GPLv3 Pylint: 9.78/10

class neo.read_skills_matrix.GeneralMatrix(workbook, sheet_name, first_row=1)[source]

Bases: object

This class is a basic class that gets properties of a spreadsheet table Other classes are inheriting from this one

get_nperson_per_skill(rses, skills)[source]

Get the number of person per skill We add a +1 to the skill score if the person as a number higher than 1 or a Yes

Parameter

skillnamestr

skill for which we want the score

Return

skill_scoreint

score for the skill

get_rses()[source]

This method gets the name of all RSEs in the subskill matrix

Parameter

None

Return

rses dict

column letter <==> RSE name

get_skills_list(column_skills='A')[source]

This method gets the name of all the skills listed in the subskill matrix We assume that the list starts on cell A-3 and goes on the 1st column

Parameter

column_skillsstr

column letter with skills. Defaut is ‘A’

Return

skills list

list of skills for that matrix

get_skills_per_person(rsecolumn, rsename, skills)[source]

THis method gets the skills and proficiency for all skills in the matrix for the rse given in argument

Parameter

rsecolumn :str

column name of the rse

skillslist

of skills in the matrix

return

rse_skillsnested dict

skills : {‘prof’:X, ‘usage’:Y/N}

get_table()[source]

This method extracts the complete table. It uses the get_table_shape method to find the limits

Parameters

None

Return

None

Attributes

table : list of list of columns

get_table_shape()[source]

This method gets the shape of the matrix (rows x columns)

Parameters

skipped_lineslist

of int: Lines number to be skipped default is empty list [no skipped lines]

Returns

None

Attributes

row int

number of rows

cols int

number of columns

neo.tests module

This source code implements the tests for the module To run the test just run skills –tests

Author: R. Thomas Year: 2023-24 Place: U. of Sheffield Licence: GPLv3 Pylint: 10

Module contents

The NEO module allows you to visualise a skills matrix with polar diagrams and spider plots. You can see the documentation at:

Author: R. Thomas Place: U. of Sheffield Year: 2023 Licence: GPLv3 Pylint v3.0.3 score: 10
